results.title: The Playful pandas
results.brief_description: Shows some of the characteristics and behaviour of pandas through the story of two pandas, Ling Ling and Sang Siang in the National Zoo in Washington D.C. Using whimsical dialogue, the other zoo animals try to find out what makes the pandas so special.

results.title: The Planter's wife = outpost in Malaya
results.creator_credit: Pinnacle Productions, John Stafford and Ken Annakin
results.brief_description: The setting is Malaya in the 50’s, still a British colonial outpost, but on the verge of independence and a new Malaya. The major industry is rubber, and the majority of this control still lies with the British. Jim Frazer (Jack Hawkins) and his wife Liz (Claudette Colbert) have built a successful rubber plantation business. Liz is dissatisfied with her lifestyle and resents having to move from her social circle following her marriage. There are bigger issues at stake however, when their lives come under threat from Malay bandits, intent on usurping British rule. Fearing for his son’s safety, Jim organizes for his wife and son to return to England. Liz misinterprets her husband’s intentions for their departure and vows never to return to Malaya. She is not given the opportunity to leave however, as a surprise attack forces the family into a battle for survival. Cast includes Anthony Steel, Jeremey Spenser and Ram Gopal.

results.title: The Plantation system in southern life
results.brief_description: Social and economic development of a cultural pattern in southern United States is traced in this film. Life on a southern plantation is recreated so that historical scenes can be related to their modern counterpart. Presents information on the organisation of a plantation; economy as dominated by one crop - cotton; effect of the Civil War on the economy and the influence of the past on the life of southern people today.

results.title: The Plant
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Helene Verrier and Thomas Vamos
results.brief_description: A live-action non-narrated story about a man who brings a plant, that had been struggling up through a crack in the pavement, into his apartment. The plant is lavished with kindness by its new owner, but has a mind of its own and soon grows out of control. It encroaches into all areas of the apartment, eventually damaging it beyond repair. An open-ended film allowing scope for language development.

results.title: The Plank. Rhubarb rhubarb
results.creator_credit: Thames Television, Dennis Kirkland, David Clark and Eric Sykes
results.brief_description: The Plank is a classic silent comedy starring Eric Sykes and Arthur Lowe as two builders who find they are missing a floorboard. Untold confusion and mayhem follows as they travel across town with a replacement. Features almost every British comic actoar you can think of. “Rhubarb rhubarb” is another of Sykes’ comedies without words except for the occasional “rhubarb”. Eric Sykes is the Police Inspector whose passion in life is golf and, with the help of Jimmy Edwards tries to win no matter how. Bob Todd stars as the Vicar who is the only person left in the golf club who will play with the Inspector, but unfortunately he is a born loser.

results.title: The Planets
results.brief_description: The Planets - Gustav Holst’s greatest orchestral work - presents Eastern mysticism tinged with pagan fantasy and thoughts of the Planets shedding rays of influence upon the Earth and upon Mankind. Features the French National Orchestra, one of the most remarkable symphonic ensembles in the world, conducted by Lorin Maazel. Rated: G

results.title: The Planets
results.brief_description: This documentary series gives a comprehensive and spectacular account of space exploration and discovery. It employs a unique blend of state-of-the-art computer graphics together with previously unseen space-race archive, as well as first-hand testimony from scientists around the world. Narrated by Samuel West. Includes the brilliant musical score, “The Planets,” by Gustav Holst. Parts include: Terra Firma, Giants, Moon, Star, Atmosphere, Life, and Destiny.
